event.summary: 09/02/1993: In Colombia, the leftist guerrilla campaign called "Black September," waged by the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) and the National Liberation Army (ELN), left 38 soldiers dead in a display of force aimed at bringing the Colombian government back to the negotiating table. The total number of injuries was unknown.
event.addnotes: Rebels announced the "Black September" terrorist offensive, saying they planned to kidnap public figures, attack the military and police and sabotage the country's infrastructure. (This one of two related attacks [cf: 199309020003]).
event.scite1: “‘Black September’ Rebel Offensive Leaves 30 Security Forces Dead," Agence France Presse, September 3, 1993.
event.scite2: “Police Blame Guerrillas For Bombings and Kidnapping," Inter-Press Service, September 6, 1993.
event.scite3: “Security Stepped Up in Colombia Against Rebel Offensive," Agence France Presse, September 9, 1993.
